snippet: The driver, Jojo K. John, was intoxicated when the boat slammed into a barge near the Tappan Zee Bridge, an indictment says.
abstract: Rockland County prosecutors charge Jojo K John with 18 counts, including manslaughter and criminally negligent homicide, in connection with July boating accident on Hudson River near the Tappan Zee Bridge in which bride-to-be and groom's best man were killed; indictment cites toxicology report indicating that John had blood alcohol level of 0.15, nearly twice the legal limit.
lead_paragraph: The driver, Jojo K. John, was intoxicated when the boat slammed into a barge near the Tappan Zee Bridge, an indictment says.

headline.main: Charges in Hudson River Boat Crash That Killed Bride and Best Man
headline.print_headline: Charges in Fatal Boat Crash in Hudson
